list.title: Context
list.description: Handle collisions, add/remove gameobject3D, process commands + trigger {@link ScriptBase} event

list.title: Context#addObject3D
list.description: Add an object3D in context. If a parentUUID is specifed it will be add to its, root otherwise

list.description: Collisions system {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-collisions}

list.title: Context#collisionsBuffer
list.description: Buffer to handle collision events {@link Context.EVENT}

list.title: Context#commands
list.description: buffer of commands to apply at the next step

list.description: Create a class instance of game script class for an object3D given an id

list.title: Context#dispatch
list.description: Dispatch custom event to listeners

list.title: Context#dispatchScriptEvent
list.description: It will dispatch an event to all {@link ScriptBase} in object3D

list.title: Diff
list.description: Store difference between two following states (state(t) + diff(t,t+1) = state(t+1))

list.title: Diff#nextStateObjectsUUID
list.description: uuids object3D present in state(t+1)

list.title: Diff#objects3DToUpdateJSON
list.description: map uuid object3D to object3D json where outdated (model has changed)

list.title: Diff#timestamp
list.description: time of state(t+1)

list.title: EventSender
list.description: Class to manage events. Represents an object that can send events. Any part of the code can listen to these events. They can either listen to specific events, or to all events.

list.title: EventSender#addEventListener
list.description: Registers an event listener attached to a specific event. The action function will be called only when event is fired.

list.title: EventSender#addListener
list.description: Registers an event listener attached to no specific event. The action function will be called when any event is fired.

list.title: EventSender#allEventsListeners
list.description: The listeners attached to no particular event. They will receive all notifications.

list.title: EventSender#eventListeners
list.description: The listeners attached to a specific event.

list.title: EventSender#registerEvent
list.description: Registers an event. Should be called by the implementing class to specify its own events.

list.title: EventSender#removeEventListener
list.description: Removes a specific event listener.

list.title: EventSender#sendEvent
list.description: Sends an event to the listeners. event must be first registers through the registerEvent method. An argument can be passed but is optional.

list.title: Interpolator
list.description:
Handle reception of states over time and can on demand compute current states that need to be processed. Current states are delivered/computed with a delay and can be interpolated in order to "smooth" them see {@link State} to have a better understanding

Very inspired (quite identical) from there {@link https://victorzhou.com/blog/build-an-io-game-part-1/#7-client-state}

list.title: Interpolator#_computeCurrentServerTime
list.description: Compute current server time, server is the entity where states are computed

list.title: Interpolator#_notConsumedStates
list.description: buffer of states deprecated (out of time) but not treated (not deliver/compute)

list.title: Interpolator#computeCurrentState
list.description: Deliver/Compute current state

list.title: Interpolator#computeCurrentStates
list.description: Deliver/Compute current state + add the ones not treated/consumed

list.title: Interpolator#delay
list.description: delay between state received and state delivered

list.title: Interpolator#firstStateTimestamp
list.description: time of the first state received

list.title: Interpolator#lastTimeState
list.description: time of the last state received

list.title: Interpolator#onFirstState
list.description: Init interpolator attributes with a first state

list.title: Interpolator#onNewDiff
list.description: Compute the next state based on a {@link Diff}

list.title: Interpolator#onNewState
list.description: Add a new state to interpolator

list.title: Interpolator#ping
list.description: time between last state received and the previous one

list.title: Interpolator#startTimestamp
list.description: interpolator start time

list.title: Interpolator#states
list.description: buffer of states received

list.description: This method describe how to export your model to a json object

list.description: state of the objects moving

list.description: Move backward object3D of a certain value

list.title: NativeCommandManager.moveForward
list.description: Move forward object3D of a certain value

list.title: NativeCommandManager.moveLeft
list.description: Move letf object3D of a certain value

list.title: NativeCommandManager.moveRight
list.description: Move right object3D of a certain value

list.title: NativeCommandManager.rotate
list.description: Rotate an object3D with an euler

list.title: Object3D
list.description: Base class extended {@link THREE.Object3D} to compose 3D scene of ud-viz game

list.title: Object3D#forceToJSONComponent
list.description: force certain component to be export in json

list.title: Object3D#gameContextUpdate
list.description: true if object3D should consider game context update

list.title: Object3D#isGameObject3D
list.description: tag to make difference between this and THREE.Object3D

list.title: Object3D#matrixAutoUpdate
list.description: {@link https://threejs.org/docs/#manual/en/introduction/How-to-update-things}

list.title: Object3D#name
list.description: name of object3D

list.title: Object3D#outdated
list.description: true if object3D model has changed

list.title: Object3D#parentUUID
list.description: uuid of the parent object3D

list.title: Object3D#static
list.description: true if the object3D is not going to move in space

list.title: Object3D#traverse
list.description: Apply a callback to object3D and its children recursively like {@link THREE.Object3D} This is not exactly the same one since there is the possibility to stop the traverse and the possibility to remove an object3D while parent is traversed

list.title: Object3D#userData
list.description: user data

list.title: Object3D#uuid
list.description: uuid of object3D

list.title: Object3D.deepCopy
list.description: Return a deep copy of object3D (uuids and name are regenerated)

list.title: Object3D.fetchFirstGameObject3D
list.description: Parse parent object till finding a gameobject

list.title: Object3D.parseJSON
list.description: If json has metadata update object of object3D if not nothing is done

list.title: PartialString
list.description: Part of a global string

list.description: part of the initial string

list.title: PartialString#index
list.description: index of the position of this in the initial string

list.title: PartialString#setIndex
list.description: Set the index of this

list.title: PartialString#setTotalPartialStringCount
list.description: Set the total partial string count

list.title: PartialString#stringUUID
list.description: uuid of the initial string splited

list.title: PartialString#totalPartialStringCount
list.description: total number of partial string of the initial string

list.title: PolygonJSON
list.description: json object to configure {@link Polygon} of {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-collisions}

list.title: ProcessInterval
list.description: Create a loop process based on the setInterval native js method

list.title: ProcessInterval#addtickRequester
list.description: Add a ProcessIntervalTickRequester

list.title: ProcessInterval#fps
list.description: frame rate per second of the process

list.title: ProcessInterval#pause
list.description: if true the process is not going to call ProcessIntervalTickRequester

list.title: ProcessInterval#setPause
list.description: Pause the process (ProcessIntervalTickRequester are not going to be called)

list.title: ProcessInterval#start
list.description: Start the process (First call of the setInterval)

list.title: ProcessInterval#stop
list.description: Stop the process

list.title: ProcessInterval#tickRequesters
list.description: buffer of the ProcessIntervalTickRequester

list.title: RenderModel
list.description: Render object3D component model store data to render an object3D (in an external context), a render controller should be implemented to use it

list.title: RenderModel#color
list.description: color to apply to the 3D model

list.title: RenderModel#idRenderData
list.description: id of render data

list.title: ScriptBase
list.description: Skeleton of a game context script, different {@link Context.EVENT} are trigger by {@link Context}

list.title: ScriptBase#context
list.description: context of this script

list.title: ScriptBase#init
list.description: call after object3D load and register in collision system

list.title: ScriptBase#isColliding
list.description: call if object3D is not static and is colliding a static object3D (object3D must have {@link Collider})

list.title: ScriptBase#load
list.description: call after object3D controllers initialized

list.title: ScriptBase#object3D
list.description: object3D attach to this script

list.title: ScriptBase#onEnterCollision
list.description: call if object3D is not static and first collide a static object3D (object3D must have {@link Collider})

list.title: ScriptBase#onLeaveCollision
list.description: call if object3D is not static and was colliding a static object3D (object3D must have {@link Collider})

list.title: ScriptBase#tick
list.description: call every step

list.title: ScriptBase#variables
list.description: custom variables attach to this script

list.title: ScriptController
list.description: Controller of object3D script component

list.title: ScriptController#execute
list.description: Execute all scripts for a particular event

list.title: ScriptController#executeScript
list.description: Execute a script for a particular event

list.title: ScriptController#scripts
list.description: instances of scripts

list.title: ScriptController#setVariables
list.description: Modify variables of the model + overwrite variables in scripts

list.title: ScriptModel
list.description: Model of object3D script component

list.title: ScriptModel#idScripts
list.description: ids of scripts

list.title: ScriptModel#variables
list.description: custom global variables passed to scripts

list.title: ShapeWrapper
list.description: Wrap {@link Polygon} or {@link Circle} of {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-collisions}

list.title: ShapeWrapper#initShapeFromJSON
list.description: Initialize shape of {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-collisions} and update method then attach a getter to the object3D to the shape

list.title: ShapeWrapper#json

list.title: ShapeWrapper#object3D
list.description: object3D parent of the controller collider

list.title: ShapeWrapper#shape
list.description: {@link Circle} or {@link Polygon} of {@link https://www.npmjs.com/package/detect-collisions}

list.title: ShapeWrapper#update
list.description: update world transform of shape

list.title: ShapeWrapper#update
list.description: update world transform of shape

list.title: State
list.description: Store state of context at a given time

list.title: State#_consumed
list.description: flag to determine if state has been consumed/treated

list.title: State#add
list.description: Compute next state based on a {@link Diff}

list.title: State#includes
list.description: Check if there is an object3D with a given uuid

list.title: State#object3D
list.description: context root object3D

list.title: State#sub
list.description: Compute the diff between this and previous state

list.title: State#timestamp
list.description: time when the state has been created in ms

list.title: State#toJSON
list.description: export state to serializable json object

list.title: State.interpolate
list.description: Compute a state interpolated between s1 and s2 with a given ratio

list.title: StringComposer
list.description: Recompose string with {@link PartialString}

list.title: StringComposer#buffer
list.description: buffer of all string being recompose

list.title: StringComposer#recompose
list.description: Recompose a string with a partial string

list.title: StringComposer.MAX_STRING_SIZE
list.description: Max size of the data of a {@link PartialString}

list.title: StringComposer.splitString
list.description: Split a large string (superior at {@link StringComposer.MAX_STRING_SIZE}) into {@link PartialString}

list.title: arrayEquals
list.description: Check if both array are equals

list.description: Take an array of string and check if it is in euler format

list.description: Take an array of string and check if it is in matrix4 format

list.title: checkIfSubStringIsVector3
list.description: Take an array of string and check if it is in vector3 format

list.title: computeFileFormat
list.description: Compute the last string after the . in the filename

list.title: dataUriToBuffer
list.description: Convert a data URI into a Buffer

list.title: eulerArrayFromURIComponent
list.description: Taking a string from the unpacking URI and splitting it into an array of strings.

list.title: getAttributeByPath
list.description: Gets an attribute of an object from the given path. To get nested attributes, the path qualifiers must be separated by dots ('.'). If the path is not nested (does not contain any dot), the function is equivalent to obj[path].

list.title: imageToDataURI
list.description: Converts the raw content of an array buffer (as retrieved by a GET request on a file) to a data URI. This is required, for example, to display images fetched from the server. As we need authentication headers to retrieve some protected files, we get the raw data dynamically and need to convert it to a data URI do display it. The basic scheme of the URI is defined in the RFC 2397, with the mediaType set to mimeType and the raw data converted to base64.

list.title: int32ArrayToObject
list.description: Convert a Int32Array into an Object

list.title: matrix4ArrayFromURIComponent
list.description: Taking a string from the unpacking URI and splitting it into an array of strings.

list.title: removeEmptyValues
list.description: Removes empty fields from a FormData. Useful for update requests that would update those fields to an empty string if they were sent in the body. To check if a value is empty, this function just convert it into a boolean.

list.title: vector3ArrayFromURIComponent
list.description: Taking a string from the unpacking URI and splitting it into an array of strings.
